posts.message:
[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/iWgCAjx.png[/IMG][/align]

[align=center]The edition you are currently reading is the [color=white][b]#237th edition[/b] of the HF News[/color]. To read any older editions of the HF News, please go [url=http://bitly.com/1FnhESq]here[/url].[/align]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/vS4lGez.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Minimum Post Length Reduced[/color][/b]
In efforts to make the forum easier to use for mobile users, the post length has dropped by 10 and is now 25 characters. Many were surprised as the 35 character limit kept spam posting at a lower level. Moreover, the minimum character count once peaked at 50. The lowered restriction is expected cut down the number of 35 character bypass reports which staff must deal with, allowing more time to tend to other issues. [i][size=x-small][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4790930]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Tabs Due for the Scrap?[/color][/b]
Hack Forums inadvertently set the standard for forum layout with the tab system. Now, that same system may be scrapped in favor of one continuous page, making mobile use 'easier'. Many members feel uncomfortable losing the tabs but others are willing to embrace change. [i][size=x-small][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4790779]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Awards Now Automated[/color][/b]
The range of donation awards from Emerald Donator through Grand Amethyst are now automatically issued when purchased from the new [url=http://hackforums.net/buyawards.php]buy awards page[/url], allowing [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] to work on further site changes without pausing to manually grant a donation award. In addition, the long sought-after Benefactor award finally has a price tag of $200. This new automation system is expected to support sticky purchasing in the near future. [i][size=x-small][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4791796]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Innuendo Section Tightened[/color][/b]
Many members have expressed concern over the falling quality in the Innuendo section. To help suppress this, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] has introduced a minimum prestige requirement of 25 before non-upgraded members can post as recently implemented in the Science, Religion, Philosophy, and Politics section. Upgraded members are not subject to this. [i][size=x-small][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4787838]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/3o4WXW0.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][color=black][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1057942]The Judge[/url][/color][/font][/size][spoiler=][align=left]

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1014629][color=#87CEEB][b]Astute:[/b][/color][/url] Hello Judge. Welcome to the 237th Edition of the HF News. Any shoutouts before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1057942][color=white][b]The Judge:[/b][/color][/url] Thanks! I'd like to give a shoutout to Krew, Heulen, Sky, rmsg0d and the Titans!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1014629][color=#87CEEB][b]Astute:[/b][/color][/url] So tell us Judge, what got you started on HackForums?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1057942][color=white][b]The Judge:[/b][/color][/url] Well, I discovered HF from a friend that played RuneScape with me, he told me it's a chill forum to learn and earn money, so I decided to sign up and find out. And look at me now, 4 years later.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1014629][color=#87CEEB][b]Astute:[/b][/color][/url] Nice. At the end of those 4 years, what have you learned from HackForums?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1057942][color=white][b]The Judge:[/b][/color][/url] Basically I've learned that people will rise and fall, ups and downs will happen to the forum, that the forum consists of very nice people whom I've met a lot of years ago and still talk to. Oh and not to forget: everyone who says that they don't care about rep is lying.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1014629][color=#87CEEB][b]Astute:[/b][/color][/url] Interesting input. So how much time do you spend on HF daily?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1057942][color=white][b]The Judge:[/b][/color][/url] Hmm, that depends on factors from my real life (school, job) but I end up spending about 7 to 8 hours a day on HF. I might not be posting the whole time but the HF tab is up though. Sometime someone told me that the fastest way to contact me is to PM me on HF as I check my PM's regularly on my Phone!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1014629][color=#87CEEB][b]Astute:[/b][/color][/url] Out of curiosity, what do you do for a living? Does your job take up much time?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1057942][color=white][b]The Judge:[/b][/color][/url] I am a student and I work at a marketing bureau. Most of the time I'm early done with my work. That's when HF comes in handy. I'd say HF takes more from my time than my job in real life.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1014629][color=#87CEEB][b]Astute:[/b][/color][/url] Do you have any sort of business on HF? If so, how does the revenue generated from it compare to what you earn from your job?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1057942][color=white][b]The Judge:[/b][/color][/url] I do not have any business on HF at the moment but I do work for people outside of HF whom I met on HF sometimes. I am starting with many products very soon. Expect them within a week! I won't spoil it yet though but it's going to be worth it. I did generate a lot revenue through HF awhile ago. And it was certainly worth the time I've spent on HF.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1014629][color=#87CEEB][b]Astute:[/b][/color][/url] That's great. For those who are new to HF, do you have any advice / recommendations for them?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1057942][color=white][b]The Judge:[/b][/color][/url] Yes I do. If you wish to have a great time on HF you should find your place in the subforum. And start communicating with people there. Eventually that becomes boring. So you should join either join an official or unofficial group which you like the direction or theme of. I've had a lot of fun in Skype calls with other members which led me to sleep at 5AM or so. Wouldn't trade that with anything else. As if you would like to start earning money from HF. Please come with original ideas when selling products. Don't use cliché niches but make them yourself. However if you do decide to use cliché niches. Then please make sure it's quality as that is the key on getting customers.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1014629][color=#87CEEB][b]Astute:[/b][/color][/url] Great advice. So Judge, could you tell us what your aspirations are for your future on HF?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1057942][color=white][b]The Judge:[/b][/color][/url] Well for now I'm just going to what I'm doing and eventually contribute more to the forum. Either in form of tutorials or donations. And in the future probably to own a group and contribute even more that way.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1014629][color=#87CEEB][b]Astute:[/b][/color][/url] If you were to own a group, what would it be centralized around?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1057942][color=white][b]The Judge:[/b][/color][/url] I'm not entirely sure. Either to have a "family" based group or to continue an existing groups image.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1014629][color=#87CEEB][b]Astute:[/b][/color][/url] Interesting. Well, unfortunately that's all the time we have here. Any final comments?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1057942][color=white][b]The Judge:[/b][/color][/url] First of all I'd like to thank you for interviewing me and being a friend for almost 2 years! And second of all to thank everyone that I met in these 4 years! And last of all I'd like to thank Omniscient for making this possible to all of us.
[/align][/spoiler]

[/align]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[color=white][b]New Exchange Volume Record[/b][/color]
Since being listed on Bittrex, Omnicoin has stayed at a steady average of .75 BTC worth of Omnicoin exchanged per day, with a previous record high of 2.85 BTC. This last week that record was broken by a whopping 3.87 BTC worth of trading done in 1 day.

[align=center][i][b][color=white]What is your opinions on country locking?[/color][/b][/i][/align]

[align=right][i][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1607053]Dex[/url][/b][/i][/align]
[align=right][i][b]"I think country locking is a very good addition to HF. I think member's accounts will be safer and overall members will feel more comfortable browsing
the forum."[/b][/i][/align]

[align=left][i][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1771320]Kody[/url]
"I think country locking is a cool idea, but if you do travel out of country there should be a verification option to prove identity to disable the function."[/b][/i][/align]

[align=right][i][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2460055]Declan‎[/url]
"I think that it is a good feature for people who want to keep their account extra secure, but I personally didn't enable it. I feared that one day I would travel to another country, and I wouldn't be able to browse HF whenever I had the spare time there."[/b][/i][/align]

[align=left][i][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1697764]Redwall[/url]
"Country locking is a great addition to HF, I feel members that have been having issues with their accounts being compromised will feel at ease. I also like that this will make Admin's jobs easier"[/i][/b][/align]

[align=center][b]This Week's Poll:
[color=white]With the new OMC features, do you feel it is enough yet to use OMC for sales and purchases?[/color][/b]
[url=http://www.poll-maker.com/poll304694x14C949d9-11]Vote Now in the Poll[size=xx-small][CLICK HERE][/size][/url][/align]
[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/l55r4R7.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]RSS Notifications - Mobile and Browser[/color][/b]
To ease the notifications of new HF News editions including Breaking News and other threads in our subforum, you can use RSS Feed Readers to get notified. If you use Chrome browser, you can use [url=https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/rss-feed-reader/pnjaodmkngahhkoihejjehlcdlnohgmp?hl=en]RSS Feed Reader[/url] by Feeder Co. It is fairly simple, just enter the syndication URL below in the add field.  For Firefox, it's a little different but you can use [url=https://addons.mozilla.org/en-us/firefox/addon/simple-rss-reader-srr/]Simple RSS Reader[/url] by Alvaro Junior. You will have to paste the syndication URL in your browser and then subscribe to the feed from there. For iOS and Android, you can use Feedly. [url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/feedly.-your-rss-news-reader./id396069556?mt=8]Click here for iOS[/url]. [url=https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.devhd.feedly&hl=en]Click here for Android[/url]. You can use Feedly for Chrome and Firefox too but I'm providing some alternatives. None of the readers I've listed are required, you can pick your own.

[i]Syndication URL:[/i] http://hackforums.net/syndication.php?fid=162&limit=5

[img]http://i.imgur.com/K3c66wm.png[/img]

[b][color=white]Userscript In the Works[/color][/b]
Don't fret, RSS is just an alternative to a userscript. It allows for mobile notifications that userscripts cannot do. We are still working on getting a working and stable notification userscript for you all to use.

[color=transparent]      [/color]
posts.subject: HF News // Edition 237

posts.message:
[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/B93DARr.png[/img][/align]

[align=left]
[color=white][b]iOS SSL and WiFi Vulnerability[/b][/color]
In every major operating system such as Windows, Linux, and OS X, there are inherent tools for checking SSL certificates against a set of trusted certificate authorities. This is meant to mitigate SSL Man-in-the-middle attacks. In such an attack, the victim attempts to make an encrypted tunnel over the internet to a given server, but the attacker hijacks the encryption and forms his own encrypted tunnel with the victim, allowing him to use his own private key to decrypt the data. This was a very simple attack to perform until browsers implemented mitigations such as DNS pinning, and trusted/untrusted certificate authorities. A vulnerability in the [url=https://github.com/AFNetworking/AFNetworking/releases/tag/2.5.1]AFNetworking 2.5.1[/url] Software Development Kit for iOS had essentially omitted SSL validation. Over 1,000 applications were developed using this faulty software allowing hackers to intercept supposedly encrypted communication by forcing clients to use their own SSL certificates. A second vulnerability found in iOS 8 affects devices such that, when connected to a malicious Wireless Access Point, the operating system simply crashes. This, too, is an issue with SSL certificates. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.theinquirer.net/inquirer/news/2405154/ssl-bug-hits-1-000-iphone-ipad-apps-including-microsoft-and-yahoo-titles]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=white][b]Adobe Flash 0-day Went Unnoticed for 2 Months[/b][/color]
In December of 2014, MalwareBytes systems detected an attack on Adobe Flash Player 14-16 that utilized a UAF (Use After Free) vulnerability, allowing attackers to write arbitrary data to parts of memory that had been allocated and then freed by the application. The attackers were able to execute arbitrary code and deployed their payloads on several sites via malware-ridden advertisements, and distributed their ransomware. These were not small-time attacks as they were executed on multiple high-traffic websites including Dailymotion, Huffington Post, Answers.com, New York Daily, and a handful of others. The ransomware payload was nothing that we haven't seen before, but the fact is that a 0-day vulnerability was being exploited for over 2 months on high-priority domains. [i][size=x-small][url=http://news.hitb.org/content/zero-day-malvertising-attack-went-undetected-two-months]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[/align]
[align=left]
[b][color=white]Microsoft Now Pays Hackers Over $15,000[/color][/b]
Microsoft is now offering over $15,000 for anyone that can find a vulnerability in their new browser called "Spartan Browser". Spartan Browser is more like Mozilla FireFox and Google Chrome. They seem to be making this new browser for the release of the new Windows 10. This browser can potentially kill off Internet Explorer. Microsoft is offering a big bug bounty for anyone that loves to code or find some sort of vulnerability. Microsoft is trying very hard to make the best of this new browser. The bugs can be any of these three, Remote Code Execution (RCE), Sandbox Escapes , or design-level security. The Spartan project is still under development.[i][size=x-small][url=http://www.hackersnewsbulletin.com/2015/04/microsoft-rewarding-hackers-15000-usd.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]
[/align]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/POnmUGI.png[/img][/align]

[color=white][b]Microsoft Launches Project Spartan Bounty[/b][/color]
Starting on the 22nd, Microsoft launched a 2 month campaign aimed at removing security vulnerabilities from Spartan, Microsoft's new web browser that will be shipped with Windows 10. Microsoft has offered up to $15,000 for bounties in regards to remote code execution, sandbox escape, and design-level issues. Microsoft also announced an expansion of its existing bug bountry program. The expansion will include bugs found on Microsoft's cloud platform, all Azure platforms, and sway.com. Microsoft also expanded the programs in the Defense program bug bounty program to include Hyper-V. Microsoft is offering up to $100,000 for active mitigation bypasses and up $50,000 for prevention of said bypasses. [url=https://threatpost.com/microsoft-launches-project-spartan-bounty/112396][size=xx-small][i]>>Source[/i][/size][/url]

[color=white][b]iOS Vulnerabilities Allows for Endless Reboot Loop[/b][/color]
While researching iOS security, researchers discovered a vulnerability that would cause an iPhone or iPad to be perpetually stuck a reboot loop. The issue is an SSL certificate phrasing vulnerability. Essentially, with a correctly configured router, an attack can create a SSL certificate that when phrased can trigger a bug on the iOS device that leads the device in to an endless reboot loop. Apple is alegedly aware of this bug and in the process of fixing it. Apple was contacted by the researches, but they have not yet received a response. It is unclear if Apple will resolve this issue in the near future.[url=https://threatpost.com/ios-vulnerability-could-force-devices-into-endless-reboot-loop/112406][size=xx-small][i] >>Source[/i][/size][/url]

[color=white][b]Google Provides Detailed Analysis of GitHub Attack[/b][/color]
After a series of DDoS attacks against GitHub last month, Google has spent weeks analyzing the network data from the attacks. After careful analysis, the researches concluded that the attackers used HTML injection and JavaScript replacement. The attackers spent the early phases of their attack deciding what the best way to attack GitHub would be. Their attacks persisted from March 3rd-6th. Google's extensive report on the attacks against GitHub can be found [url=http://googleonlinesecurity.blogspot.com/2015/04/a-javascript-based-ddos-attack-as-seen.html?m=1]here.[/url] [url=https://threatpost.com/google-provides-detailed-analysis-of-github-attack-traffic/112427][size=xx-small][i]>>Source[/i][/size][/url]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/GYH7RFn.png[/img][/align]

[align=left]
[b][color=white]Visual Novel Creation Becoming More Easily Attainable[/color][/b]
Visual novels, a mixture of stories and videogames that are popular in Eastern culture, have become easier and easier to create as the years have gone by. This fact is made quite clear by the presence [i]TyranoBuilder[/i], a drag-and-drop visual novel building piece of software that was released on Steam this past March. ShikemokuMK, creator of [i]TyranoBuilder[/i], took inspiration for the program from visual novels like [i]Steins;Gate[/i] and the works of developer Key when putting together [i]TyranoBuilder[/i]. Here is what he said about enabling writers and game-builders alike with his [i]TyranoBuilder[/i] software: "I once saw a visual novel adaptation of old Japanese literature that used backgrounds and music to convey the story. It made me realize that literature that's difficult in printed form can be more entertaining and easier to read as a game. My goal is to enable artists or writers who know nothing about programming to add stories and music to their work and express their creations as games." With programs such as [i]TyranoBuilder[/i] becoming available cheaply to potential game-creators everywhere, new levels of creativity and experimentation are helping expand the appeal of visual novels to audiences in more western cultures. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.polygon.com/2015/4/7/8355267/making-your-own-visual-novel-is-becoming-easier]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white][i]Batman Arkham Knight[/i] Reaches New Level of Delays
[/color][/b][i]Batman Arkham Knight[/i] is a game that has had formidable experience with delays, and fans know that these delays are necessary and aren’t too frustrated about them. However, it has gotten to the point where even trailers for [i]Batman Arkham Knight[/i] are being delayed past their original release date. Sefton Hill, the Game Director and co-founder of RocksteadyGames, has said, “So I promised a trailer date this week but then we thought of a much more exciting way to do this so you’ll need to wait just a bit longer.” He goes on to say, “Not to rub it in but I reviewed the latest edit and it’s looking sweet. You might well see someone familiar from Arkham City in there.” I’m sure fans will be more than happy if these claims are true. Batman Arkham Knight launches in June on the Xbox One, Playstation 4, and PC. [i][size=x-small][url=http://gamingbolt.com/batman-arkham-knight-new-trailer-looking-sweet-will-show-off-a-very-cool-feature]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Microsoft Apologizes for [i]Witcher 3[/i] Confusion
[/color][/b]On April 22nd the official Microsoft Xbox Youtube channel published a video for the upcoming game [i]The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt[/i]. The footage found in the video was thought to be extremely impressive, since many viewers thought that it was captured on the Xbox One. However, it was later discovered by [url=http://kotaku.com/xbox-youtube-channel-advertises-the-witcher-3-with-pc-f-1699455645]Kotaku[/url] that the footage found in the video was actually from the PC edition of the game. This came as a surprise to many of the viewers, since the Xbox logo was featured prominently in the video. Although it was never stated by Microsoft that the footage was from the Xbox One console, a disclaimer confirming that the footage was from the PC edition of the game was added to the video a few hours after it went up. Microsoft has officially gone on record to say that the video “was in no way intended to misrepresent the title on Xbox One. We have updated the description of the asset to make clear the source and platform of this footage. We apologize for any confusion and look forward to the game arriving on both Xbox One and PC on May 19, 2015.” [i]The Witcher 3[/i] is set to be released on the Xbox One, the Playstation 4, and PC. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/microsoft-apologizes-for-confusion-over-1080p-60fp/1100-6426814/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]
[/align]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/Br6N715.png[/img][/align]

[align=left]
[b][color=white]Samsung hints at a new smartwatch[/color][/b]
It looks like Samsung's got another smartwatch up its sleeve. Samsung Electronics teased the market with hints of a new version of its Gear smartwatch on Friday, the same day that rival Apple Inc's long-awaited wearable devices went on sale. The South Korean mobile giant on Friday posted a graphic and press release on its website saying developers can access its software development kit to build apps for an upcoming, not-yet-announced Gear wearable. The company simply said the device -- its seventh in the past two years -- would be another "wrist watch type." Gear is the name for Samsung's line of wearables that includes its Gear S curved smartwatch, its Gear Circle wireless headphones and its Gear VR virtual-reality headset. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2015/04/24/us-samsung-elec-smartwatch-apple-idUSKBN0NF0N720150424]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Amazon atop the cloud[/color][/b]
If you think you knew Amazon, things are about to change. While Amazon is primarily known as an online retailer, its revenue and its stock market returns for years have been energized by an entirely different kind of commerce: renting processing power (otherwise known as Amazon Web Services or simply AWS) to start-ups and, increasingly, established businesses. Amazon Thursday broke out the figures for AWS for the first time ever, and Wall Street liked what it saw. The division generated $5.16 billion in revenue last year and $1.56 billion in sales in the first quarter of 2015, up 49% from last year. And this is just the start: investment analysis company Morningstar expects AWS could become a $15-20 billion business in the next three years, which would make it a substantial revenue stream for the e-commerce player. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.bbc.com/news/business-32442268]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Google Fiber coming to more cities[/color][/b]
When it comes to Google Fiber, every mile of this super-fast network has to be planned -- they can’t just put it anywhere. Planning experts working for Google use the data shared with the company to create a map of where they can build (based on existing utility poles and water, gas, and electricity lines). Four years ago, Google announced it was launching its blazing fast Internet service to the Kansas City metropolitan area to boost the Midwest start-up scene. Today, Google is working to expand it's Internet service in 19 more cities in five metro areas including Salt Lake City, Atlanta, Nashville, Charlotte and Raleigh-Durham. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.cnbc.com/id/102605794]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]
[/align]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/1aU9Bfo.png[/img][/align]

[color=white][b]Earthquake Hits Nepal[/b][/color]
People have been left homeless after Nepal has one of it's largest earthquakes to date. Over 2,500 people were killed and many more are missing as emergency services are working to rescue those trapped. The earthquake had a 7.8 magnitude and hit Saturday with mass cremations taking place on Sunday. The Kathmandu Post have reported that over 70% of houses near the epicentre in rural Gorkha have been destroyed. Further casualties have been suffered in India, Bangladesh and Tibet and there is fear the expected death toll is to rise while rescue teams search isolated areas. The earthquake also caused fresh avalanches to fall from Mount Everest which then killed 13 climbers. Emergency aid is being sent out to Nepal with many volunteering to help. [i][size=x-small][url=http://news.sky.com/story/1472355/nepal-quake-homeless-spend-second-night-in-open]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=white][b]Russia Claims USA Helped Separatists[/b][/color]
Russian President Vladimir Putin has taken a fresh dig towards the USA with claims that in the early 2000's George Bush was helping separatists. The claim comes amid reports that the USA were contacting separatists which were intercepted by the Russian government. Putin has claimed he will 'kick the ass' of the intelligence officers in question. Putin mentions "they were even helping them (separatists) with transport" but won't reveal when the calls were made. Putin's main worry is that he fears the West will cause harm to Russia and world leaders would not mind Russia's 'disintegration'. [i][size=x-small][url=http://news.sky.com/story/1472570/putin-claims-us-helped-russian-separatists]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=white][b]Chile Volcano Erupts[/b][/color]
The Chile volcano Calbuco has erupted forcing over 6,500 Chileans living close to the volcano to evacuate. Over 4,500 sheep and 350 cattle have also been evacuated. Although the eruption has now finished there is worries that further eruptions may occur as the volcano is still active. The volcano spewed out over 210 million cubic meters of ash and concentrated rain is soon to come. Local airports close to the volcano have also been closed due to the activity. Chile currently has over 90 active volcanoes and has been hit by many natural disasters recently including flooding and wildfires. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-latin-america-32476797]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]BREAKING NEWS: Baltimore Funeral Breaks Into Riots[/color][/b]
During the funeral for Freddie Gray, a 25-year-old black man, a peaceful protest turned into a riot and a state of emergency has been declared. Maryland has called in the National Guard to help diffuse the situation as police and protesters clash within the streets. At least 15 officers have been injured during the clash and a week-long curfew has been announced in Baltimore which should last between 22:00 to 05:00 and begin on Tuesday. Currently the streets are littered with burnt-out cars and an extremely large fire has been started with around 80 firefighters trying to battle the carnage which has been caused. The fire has destroyed a Transformation Center which was due to open in December along with senior living center which help around 60 people. Police have currently made 27 arrests which is sure to rise as many protesters have been looting. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2015/apr/27/chaos-baltimore-dozens-clash-riot-police-multiple-/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i] [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2015/apr/27/baltimore-police-clash-protesters-freddie-gray-live]>>Source 1[/url][/size][/i] [i][size=x-small]
[url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-32490250]>>Source 2[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]     [/color]
